root: ^I heard your accent, have you been to Valencia before?
^It's my first time. I just arrived yesterday. Are you from here?
^Yes! I've lived here my whole life.
^<color=#0079C0>Uy, pues tengo mucho que decir.</color> Sorry, in English. I have a lot to say.
^Haha, it's okay. I'm trying to learn and explore as much as I can.
^People typically go to their mother's house on Sundays to eat it.
^You can also go to Palmar where <color=#0079C0>paella</color> originated or have <color=#0079C0>tapas</color>.
^<color=#0079C0>Tapas</color> are more day-to-day, like going out for dinner. They'are small dishes or a snack.
^Yes. Another note about <color=#0079C0>paella</color> is that it should only be eaten for lunch, never dinner.
^Mmhm, it's strictly forbidden to have it for dinner in Valencia.
^What can I have for dinner then?
^<color=#0079C0>Tapas</color>, little soup, whatever you want. Just not <color=#0079C0>paella</color>.
